realm-settings-help.fromDisplayName: A user-friendly name for the 'From' address (optional).
realm-settings-help.replyToDisplayName: A user-friendly name for the 'Reply-To' address (optional).
realm-settings-help.envelopeFrom: An email address used for bounces (optional).
realm-settings-help.password: SMTP password. This field is able to obtain its value from vault, use ${vault.ID} format.
realm-settings-help.frontendUrl: Set the frontend URL for the realm. Use in combination with the default hostname provider to override the base URL for frontend requests for a specific realm.
realm-settings-help.requireSsl: Is HTTPS required? 'None' means HTTPS is not required for any client IP address. 'External requests' means localhost and private IP addresses can access without HTTPS. 'All requests' means HTTPS is required for all IP addresses.
realm-settings-help.userManagedAccess: If enabled, users are allowed to manage their resources and permissions using the Account Management Console.
realm-settings-help.endpoints: Shows the configuration of the protocol endpoints
realm-settings-help.loginTheme: Select theme for login, OTP, grant, registration and forgot password pages.
realm-settings-help.accountTheme: Select theme for user account management pages.
realm-settings-help.emailTheme: Select theme for emails that are sent by the server.
realm-settings-help.displayName: Display name of provider when linked in admin console
realm-settings-help.enabled: Set if the keys are enabled
realm-settings-help.active: Set if the keys can be used for signing
realm-settings-help.AESKeySize: Size in bytes for the generated AES key. Size 16 is for AES-128, Size 24 for AES-192, and Size 32 for AES-256. WARN: Bigger keys than 128 are not allowed on some JDK implementations.
realm-settings-help.secretSize: Size in bytes for the generated secret
realm-settings-help.privateRSAKey: Private RSA Key encoded in PEM format
realm-settings-help.x509Certificate: X509 Certificate encoded in PEM format
